alert.note: Alert for Lincoln (Nevada) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS LasVegas (Southern Nevada, Southeastern California, Northwestern Arizona)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued March 16 at 2:45AM PDT by NWS LasVegas
info.description: ...FLOOD WARNING IN EFFECT UNTIL 5 PM PDT FRIDAY... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive runoff below Echo Canyon Dam. * WHERE...A portion of south central Nevada, including the following county, Lincoln. * WHEN...Until 500 PM PDT Friday. * IMPACTS...Flooding of rivers, creeks, streams, and other low-lying and flood-prone locations is imminent or occurring. Low-water crossings are inundated with water and may not be passable. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 240 AM PDT, emergency management reported higher than normal flows in Meadow Valley Wash due to water spilling over Echo Dam emergency spillway. Flooding is ongoing. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Panaca, State Route 319, low lying areas adjacent to the Meadow Valley Wash between Echo Canyon State Park and Caliente. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles. Stay away or be swept away. River banks and culverts can become unstable and unsafe.
